_emerg_resp.CoordinatingAgencyName: City of Santa Maria Fire Department

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies at the Stationary Source:

 

Lineage Logistics has a long standing commitment to worker, public and environmental safety.  This commitment is demonstrated by the resources invested in accident prevention, such as personnel training and consideration of safety in the design, operation, and maintenance of the ammonia refrigeration system.  It is Lineage Logistics policy to implement appropriate controls to prevent possible releases of regulated substances.  



The Program 3 at Lineage Logistics - Santa Maria, is a facility run program with continuous support from Lineage Logistics - Compliance Department that includes; Process Safety Management (PSM) Compliance and Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) Compliance.   





Stationary Source and Regulated Substance Handled:



Lineage Logistics - Santa Maria is located at 1349 West La Brea Avenue in Santa Maria, California. The facility is situated approximately 2 miles west of Highway 101 and 1 mile south of Highway 166. 



The facility was constructed and began operations in 2014.  

The regulated substance handled at the facility is anhydrous ammonia.  The facility's primary activities revolve around large-scale public storage of food products.  All of the ammonia inventory is used as refrigerant.



General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps:



As part of the implementation of the RMP Program, key Prevention Program elements were documented and implemented by Lineage Logistics - Santa Maria, which also serve to manage process safety issues associated with the use of anhydrous ammonia.  Furthermore, common industry standards, policies, and procedures are currently utilized to ensure safe practices are being performed.  



The regulated substance is over the 10,000-lbs. federal threshold for EPA RMP and OSHA PSM.   As a result, the anhydrous ammonia covered process (ammonia refrigeration system) is subject to O

SHA PSM and EPA Program 3.

Program 3 Prevention Program Elements include:

?Process Safety Information

?Process Hazard Analysis

?Operating Procedures

?Training

?Mechanical Integrity

?Management of Change

?Pre- Start Safety Review

?Compliance Audits

?Incident Investigation

?Employee Participation

?Hot Work Permit

?Contractors



Five-Year Accident History:



For any accidental release meeting the five-year accident history reporting criteria of ?68.42(a), the owner or operator shall submit as part of the RMP the information required by Section ?68.42(b) on each accident covered by section ?68.42(a).



"The owner or operator shall include in the five-year accident history all accidental releases from covered processes that resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage on site, or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage."

Lineage Logistics - Santa Maria has had no releases in the last five years (April 22, 2014 - April 22, 2019) that meets the five-year accident history reporting criteria, therefore no data is required. 



Emergency Response Program:



In addition, Lineage Logistics - Santa Maria has an Emergency Action Plan (EAP) in place to properly prepare for emergency evacuations, to provide first aid and medical treatment and to contact federal, state and local officials in the event of a major release of ammonia. The Facility Emergency Response Plan is coordinated with the local responding units, such as the local fire department or HAZMAT Team. 

Planned Changes To Improve Safety



Several studies have been conducted to examine mitigation measures to improve safety at the facility.  These studies include:

?A Hazard Assessment, which performed April 19, 2019.

?A Process Hazard Analysis, which was performed in March 13, 2019.

?A Compliance audit, which was performed in May 5, 2017.

Any outstanding recommendations from these studies and the target completion dat
e or closure have been provided within each individual report.
